title: Reference​
content: </> interface Reference { Name: string Client: table? [any]: any } Acts as a reference to new services.

title: Service​
content: </> interface Service { Name: string Client: ServiceClient Communication: Comm [any]: any }

title: OnStart​
content: </> IndiumServer.OnStart() → Promise Returns a promise that is resolved once Indium has started. Indium.OnStart():andThen(function() local ExampleService = Indium.Services.ExampleService ExampleService:DoSomething() end):catch(warn)

title: CreateService​
content: </> IndiumServer:CreateService(ref: Reference) → Service Creates and returns a new service. caution While creating a service after Indium starts is fine, it is heavily advised against. -- Create an example service local ExampleService = Indium.CreateService({ Name = "ExampleService", Client = {}, }) -- IndiumStart is called after Indium is initialized function ExampleService:IndiumStart() print(self.Name, "has started!") end -- IndiumInit is called when Indium is first started function ExampleService:IndiumInit() print(self.Name, "has initialized!") end

title: AddServices​
content: </> IndiumServer:AddServices(Parent: Instance ) → {Service} Requires the descendants of the specified parent that are a module. Indium.AddServices(path.to.Services)

title: GetService​
content: </> IndiumServer:GetService(Name: string) → Service Gets the service from the name that is specified.

title: Start​
content: </> IndiumServer:Start() → Promise Starts Indium and should only be called once. You may create services before and after Indium starts. caution There is currently no option to add middleware. This feature will be added soon. Indium:Start():andThen(function() print("Indium started!") end):catch(warn)
